ygData.subject: Re: [eqbards] GZ answers some bard questions
ygData.msgSnippet: Hmm... My strength is already more than adequate.  9 stamina really does nothing for me and 10CR is very limited.  I d use the Imbrued on dragon runs but day
ygData.messageBody:
Hmm...

My strength is already more than adequate. 9 stamina really does nothing
for me and 10CR is very limited. I'd use the Imbrued on dragon runs but day
to day I'd go with the Singing Steel for the extra AC. Since I don't
particularly need the addes strength of the Imbrued and other than that
they're not really any better.

Just my thoughts. My str is 100 and I have 2 weight reducing bags so
encumbrance is never a problem unless I'm lugging bronze armor around. So I
don't have a lot of use for +STR unless the AC that comes with it is better
than what I already have. Now if Imbrued had +CHA or DEX I would use them
in a heartbeat.

Lyrnia
----- Original Message -----
From: "Greg Gillan" <ggillan@...>
To: <eqbards@egroups.com>
Sent: Friday, May 19, 2000 12:29 PM
Subject: RE: [eqbards] GZ answers some bard questions


> Sorry, guess I should clarify. The boots are decent if you don't have
> planar.
> Compare them to imbrued though. 18ac, no stats vs. 16ac, 5str, 9sta,
10CR.
> Which would you wear?
>
>
> Elwyn <Da`Kor>
> 53 Minstrel of Erollisi Marr
>
> -----Original Message-----
> From: Kevin L. Crawford [mailto:Lyrnia@...]

> To: eqbards@egroups.com
> Subject: Re: [eqbards] GZ answers some bard questions
>
>
> Uhh forgive my ignorance...
>
> Why wouldn't you wear them? They're AC 18!?!? I wear mine now, even with
> the silly 1 water proc. My lambent boots are far lower in AC than the
> singing steel... can you explain why you wouldn't wear the steel?
>
> Just curious.
>
> Lyrnia
> ----- Original Message -----
> From: "Greg Gillan" <ggillan@...>
> To: <eqbards@egroups.com>
> Sent: Friday, May 19, 2000 11:08 AM
> Subject: RE: [eqbards] GZ answers some bard questions
>
>
> > Even if the boots summoned 20 water at once like the level 24 mage
spell,
> > I'd find them more useful. Mind you, they'd still stay in my backpack
and
> > only come out when I'm thirsty.
> > I just cant be bothered to click on the damn things 20 times to get a
> usable
> > amount of water. I don't know any caster that bothers to use their
single
> > food/drink summoning spells, its just too much trouble. Its not exactly
> > hard or expensive to buy a large supply of food/drink and carry it with
> you.
> >
> >
> > Elwyn <Da`Kor>
